New Records: 120 is the smallest total that India have defended in T20I and also the lowest target that Pakistan have failed to chase.
Key Match Events: Jasprit Bumrah took 3 wickets for 14 runs.
India defended 119 runs in a thrilling game.
Pakistan were 57-0 after ten overs but fell away in the second ten.
Rizwan and Zaman wickets were turning points in Pakistan’s innings.
Hardik Pandya bowled very well in the middle overs.
Jasprit Bumrah's penultimate over went for just three runs.
Pakistan needed 18 from six balls but fell short.
Naseem Shah was in tears as he walked off.
India's players celebrated after winning the match.
Pre-Game Insights: Pakistan won the toss and chose to bowl.
Post-Match Reflections: Rohit Sharma acknowledged that India didn't bat well enough but praised the bowlers for their performance.
Rohit Sharma highlighted the never-say-die attitude in the team.
Bumrah is going from strength to strength and is considered a genius with the ball.
Babar Azam reflected on the missed opportunity and the pressure of dot balls.
Bumrah expressed his happiness with the crowd support and focused on the present.
Babar Azam mentioned that Pakistan's tactics were simple but they failed to capitalize.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The crowd was superb and supported India in huge numbers.
The match was played at Nassau stadium in New York.
The game was part of the T20 World Cup 2024.
